04—Design Principles

System, not styles

A Cohesive Luxury Design System

Principles that ensure visual harmony, narrative clarity, and operational consistency across the entire portfolio.

01

Cohesive color system

Warm neutrals, deep charcoal, subtle tints. Tokens drive usage across backgrounds, surfaces, and actions. Icons inherit currentColor; no ad-hoc colors.

02

Typographic hierarchy with intent

Cormorant Garamond for display, Inter for body. Fluid scale, tight tracking on display, generous line-height on body. Max 60–75ch measure.

03

Spatial rhythm and structure

8px grid, generous negative space, predictable containers. Sections scaffolded with PerfectSection ensure uniform rhythm.

04

Component consistency via tokens

All components consume a single design system for spacing, radii, and color. No inline hex values; variants are systemized.

05

Subtle, meaningful motion

Ease [0.22,1,0.36,1], 240–600ms durations, restrained stagger. Motion supports comprehension; respects reduced motion.

06

Texture and materiality

Soft shadows and restrained translucency for depth—never heavy glassmorphism. Clear z-order and focus.

07

Imagery that carries the brand

Edge-to-edge heroes with consistent aspect ratios and warm grading. Imagery aligns with palette and tone.

08

Accessibility as a standard

WCAG AA contrast, semantic structure, keyboard focus, and clear labels. Inclusive by default.

09

Performance and polish

Font swap, predictable CLS, lazy media, correct image sizes. Smooth interactions without jank.

10

Touch-first ergonomics

44px targets and comfortable spacing. Hover is additive; core interactions work perfectly on touch.

11

Content clarity and narrative flow

Each section has a single intent: Introduce, Support, Prove, Invite. Services pair value statements with one proof-point.

12

System over styles

Tokens and patterns precede custom styling. One change updates the product consistently and safely.
